description.zh-cn: 中国政治家、革命家和政治理论家，于1949年建立了中华人民共和国，并从建国直至1976年去世一直领导该国。他自1943年起担任中国共产党中央委员会主席，并从1935年起成为党的实际领导人。他的理论被称为毛泽东思想。
description.en: A Chinese politician, revolutionary, and political theorist who founded the People's Republic of China (PRC) in 1949 and led the country from its establishment until his death in 1976. Mao served as chairman of the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) from 1943 until his death, and as the party's de facto leader from 1935. His theories are known as Maoism.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的创始和唯一执政党。
description.en: The founding and sole ruling party of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 由中国共产党领导的社会主义国家，通常简称为中国。
description.en: A socialist state led by the Chinese Communist Party, commonly known as China.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东的第二任妻子，中国妇女解放运动的先驱。
description.en: Mao Zedong's second wife and a pioneer of the Chinese women's liberation movement.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东的第三任妻子，一位共产主义革命家。
description.en: Mao Zedong's third wife and a communist revolutionary.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东的第四任妻子，文化大革命期间“四人帮”的核心成员。
description.en: Mao Zedong's fourth wife and a central member of the 'Gang of Four' during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东的第一任妻子，这是一场他从未承认的包办婚姻。
description.en: Mao Zedong's first wife, in an arranged marriage that he never acknowledged.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东的父亲，韶山的一位富裕农民。
description.en: Mao Zedong's father, a prosperous farmer in Shaoshan.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东的母亲，一位虔诚的佛教徒。
description.en: Mao Zedong's mother, a devout Buddhist.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东与杨开慧的长子，在朝鲜战争中阵亡。
description.en: The eldest son of Mao Zedong and Yang Kaihui, who was killed in action during the Korean War.

description.zh-cn: 位于中国湖南省长沙市的一所师范大学。
description.en: A normal university located in Changsha, Hunan province, China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国的主要政党之一，曾在中国大陆执政，后迁至台湾。
description.en: A major political party in the Republic of China, which formerly ruled mainland China and later relocated to Taiwan.

nodes.id: Chairman of the Chinese Communist Party

zh-cn: Chairman of the Chinese Communist Party
中国共产党中央委员会主席
en: Chairman of the Chinese Communist Party

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党在1945年至1982年期间的最高领导人职位。
description.en: The position of the leader of the Chinese Communist Party from 1945 to 1982.

nodes.id: Chairman of the People's Republic of China

zh-cn: Chairman of the People's Republic of China
en: Chairman of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的国家元首职位。
description.en: The head of state of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国武装力量的最高军事领导机关。
description.en: The highest national military command authority of the armed forces of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的一项旨在迅速将国家从农业经济转变为工业化社会的经济和社会运动。
description.en: An economic and social campaign in the People's Republic of China which aimed to rapidly transform the country from an agrarian economy into an industrialized society.

description.zh-cn: 由毛泽东发动的中华人民共和国的一场社会政治运动，以阶级斗争、破坏历史文物和个人崇拜为标志。
description.en: A sociopolitical movement in the People's Republic of China launched by Mao Zedong, marked by violent class struggle, destruction of historical artifacts, and Mao's cult of personality.

description.zh-cn: 中国革命家、教育家、哲学家和作家，中国共产党的联合创始人和首任总书记。
description.en: A Chinese revolutionary, educator, philosopher, and writer, who co-founded the Chinese Communist Party and served as its first General Secretary.

description.zh-cn: 中国知识分子、革命家，中国共产党的联合创始人，被认为是中国马克思主义的先驱。
description.en: A Chinese intellectual and revolutionary who co-founded the Chinese Communist Party, considered a pioneer of Marxism in China.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治家和军事领袖，曾任中华民国总统和中国国民党领导人。
description.en: A Chinese politician and military leader who served as the President of the Republic of China and leader of the Kuomintang.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国发生的一场导致数千万人死亡的全国性饥荒，主要由大跃进政策引起。
description.en: A nationwide famine in the People's Republic of China that resulted in tens of millions of deaths, largely caused by the Great Leap Forward policies.

description.zh-cn: 中国革命家、政治家和理论家，曾任中华人民共和国主席，在文化大革命期间遭到清洗。
description.en: A Chinese revolutionary, politician, and theorist who served as Chairman of the People's Republic of China and was purged during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党军事领袖，中华人民共和国元帅，曾被指定为毛泽东的接班人，后在九一三事件中身亡。
description.en: A military leader of the Chinese Communist Party and a Marshal of the People's Republic of China, who was designated as Mao Zedong's successor before dying in the Lin Biao incident.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党著名军事领袖，中华人民共和国元帅，因在庐山会议上批评大跃进而被清洗。
description.en: A prominent military leader of the Chinese Communist Party and a Marshal of the People's Republic of China, who was purged for criticizing the Great Leap Forward at the Lushan Conference.

description.zh-cn: 中国杰出的共产主义领导人，中华人民共和国首任国务院总理。
description.en: A prominent Communist leader of China and the first Premier of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 一个横跨欧亚大陆的社会主义国家，存在于1922年至1991年。
description.en: A socialist state that spanned Eurasia from 1922 to 1991.

description.zh-cn: 在斯大林去世后领导苏联，担任苏共中央第一书记和苏联部长会议主席。
description.en: Led the Soviet Union after the death of Stalin, serving as First Secretary of the Communist Party and Chairman of the Council of Ministers.

description.zh-cn: 美国第37任总统，其任内实现了中美关系正常化。
description.en: The 37th President of the United States, whose presidency saw the normalization of relations with China.

description.zh-cn: 自1920年代中期起至1953年去世，一直担任苏联的领导人。
description.en: Leader of the Soviet Union from the mid-1920s until his death in 1953.

description.zh-cn: 中国北京的一所主要研究型大学。
description.en: A major research university in Beijing, China.

description.zh-cn: 中国工农红军为躲避国民党军队的围剿而进行的一次大规模军事撤退。
description.en: A massive military retreat undertaken by the Red Army of the Chinese Communist Party to evade the pursuit of the Kuomintang army.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党在长征途中举行的一次重要会议，确立了毛泽东在党和红军中的领导地位。
description.en: A crucial meeting of the Chinese Communist Party during the Long March, which established Mao Zedong's leadership position in the Party and the Red Army.

description.zh-cn: 在中国抗日战争期间，中国国民党和中国共产党之间为抵抗日本侵略而结成的短暂联盟。
description.en: A brief alliance between the Kuomintang (KMT) and the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) to resist the Japanese invasion during the Second Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 1927年国民党对共产党人及其同情者进行的大规模清洗。
description.en: A large-scale purge of Communists and their sympathizers by the Kuomintang in 1927.

description.zh-cn: 位于中国湖南省的县级市，是毛泽东的出生地。
description.en: A county-level city in Hunan province, China, and the birthplace of Mao Zedong.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东是毛贻昌的儿子。
description.en: Mao Zedong was the son of Mao Yichang.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东是文七妹的儿子。
description.en: Mao Zedong was the son of Wen Qimei.

description.zh-cn: 罗一秀是毛泽东的第一任妻子，这是一场他从未承认的包办婚姻。
description.en: Luo Yixiu was Mao Zedong's first wife in an arranged marriage that he never acknowledged.

description.zh-cn: 杨开慧是毛泽东的第二任妻子。
description.en: Yang Kaihui was Mao Zedong's second wife.

description.zh-cn: 贺子珍是毛泽东的第三任妻子。
description.en: He Zizhen was Mao Zedong's third wife.

description.zh-cn: 江青是毛泽东的第四任妻子。
description.en: Jiang Qing was Mao Zedong's fourth wife.

description.zh-cn: 毛岸英是毛泽东与杨开慧的长子。
description.en: Mao Anying was the eldest son of Mao Zedong and Yang Kaihui.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东毕业于湖南第一师范学院。
description.en: Mao Zedong graduated from Hunan First Normal University.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东曾在北京大学担任图书馆助理员。
description.en: Mao Zedong worked as an assistant librarian at Peking University.

description.zh-cn: 在北京大学图书馆工作期间，毛泽东是图书馆馆长李大钊的下属。
description.en: While working at the Peking University Library, Mao Zedong was a subordinate of the head librarian, Li Dazhao.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东是中国共产党的创始成员之一，并于1921年建立了长沙支部。
description.en: Mao Zedong was a founding member of the Chinese Communist Party and established a branch in Changsha in 1921.

description.zh-cn: 陈独秀是中国共产党的联合创始人。
description.en: Chen Duxiu was a co-founder of the Chinese Communist Party.

description.zh-cn: 李大钊是中国共产党的联合创始人。
description.en: Li Dazhao was a co-founder of the Chinese Communist Party.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东于1949年10月1日宣布成立中华人民共和国。
description.en: Mao Zedong proclaimed the founding of the People's Republic of China on October 1, 1949.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东发起了大跃进运动，旨在将中国从农业国转变为工业国。
description.en: Mao Zedong launched the Great Leap Forward movement to transform China from an agrarian nation into an industrialized one.

description.zh-cn: 大跃进运动的政策导致了劳动力转移和粮食产量下降，是造成大饥荒的直接原因。
description.en: The policies of the Great Leap Forward led to a diversion of labor and a drop in grain production, which was a direct cause of the great famine.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东于1966年发起了文化大革命，以期通过一场文化革命来撼动“统治阶级”并使中国保持“不断革命”的状态。
description.en: Mao Zedong launched the Cultural Revolution in 1966, believing that a revolution of culture would unseat the 'ruling class' and keep China in a state of 'continuous revolution'.

description.zh-cn: 刘少奇是文化大革命期间被清洗和迫害的著名受害者之一。
description.en: Liu Shaoqi was one of the prominent figures purged and persecuted during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东领导的共产党与蒋介石领导的国民党在中国内战中是敌对双方。
description.en: The Communist Party led by Mao Zedong and the Kuomintang led by Chiang Kai-shek were opposing sides in the Chinese Civil War.

description.zh-cn: 在1959年的庐山会议上，彭德怀因批评大跃进而被毛泽东清洗。
description.en: Following Peng Dehuai's criticism of the Great Leap Forward at the Lushan Conference in 1959, Mao purged him.

description.zh-cn: 到1971年，毛泽东与他指定的接班人林彪之间的分歧变得明显。林彪在一次飞机失事中丧生，中共后来宣布他曾策划推翻毛泽东。
description.en: By 1971, a divide between Mao and his designated successor Lin Biao had become apparent. Lin Biao died in a plane crash, and the CCP later declared he was planning to depose Mao.

description.zh-cn: 赫鲁晓夫的去斯大林化政策以及对资本主义国家的“和平共处”政策导致了中苏分裂，毛泽东将赫鲁晓夫视为修正主义者。
description.en: Khrushchev's de-Stalinization and 'peaceful coexistence' policies led to the Sino-Soviet split, with Mao viewing Khrushchev as a revisionist.

description.zh-cn: 在西安事变后，中国共产党和国民党组成了第二次统一战线，共同抗击日本侵略。
description.en: After the Xi'an Incident, the Chinese Communist Party and the Kuomintang formed the Second United Front to jointly resist the Japanese invasion.

description.zh-cn: 蒋介石在上海发动了“四一二政变”（白色恐怖），大规模屠杀共产党员。
description.en: Chiang Kai-shek unleashed the 'White Terror' in Shanghai, massacring thousands of Communists.

description.zh-cn: 白色恐怖导致数万名共产党员及同情者被杀害，使中共遭受重创。
description.en: The White Terror resulted in the deaths of tens of thousands of Communists and sympathizers, dealing a severe blow to the CCP.

description.zh-cn: 遵义会议确立了毛泽东在党和红军中的领导地位，使他成为事实上的领导人。
description.en: The Zunyi Conference established Mao Zedong's leadership position in the Party and the Red Army, making him the de facto leader.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东于1972年在北京会见了时任美国总统理查德·尼克松，开启了中美关系正常化的进程。
description.en: Mao Zedong met with U.S. President Richard Nixon in Beijing in 1972, initiating the process of normalizing China-U.S. relations.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东于1949-1950年冬访问莫斯科，与斯大林举行会谈，并签署了《中苏友好同盟互助条约》。
description.en: Mao visited Moscow in the winter of 1949–50 for talks with Stalin, resulting in the Sino-Soviet Treaty of Friendship, Alliance and Mutual Assistance.

description.zh-cn: 二战后，苏联占领了中国东北，并秘密地将其移交给中国共产党，为毛泽东的军队提供了重要支持。
description.en: After World War II, the Soviet Union occupied northeastern China and secretly gave it to the Chinese communists, providing significant support to Mao's forces.

description.zh-cn: 周恩来长期担任中华人民共和国国务院总理，是毛泽东政府中的关键人物和直接下属。
description.en: Zhou Enlai served as the long-time Premier of the People's Republic of China, a key figure and direct subordinate in Mao Zedong's government.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东出生于湖南省韶山村。
description.en: Mao Zedong was born in Shaoshan village, Hunan province.
